intro: Cerastium glabratum subsp. glaberrimum, commonly known as the glabrous mouse-ear cress, is a low-growing perennial plant native to the mountainous regions of western North America. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many flowering plants with small, cruciform flowers. The plant features dense clusters of white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in early spring. Its leaves are small, rounded, and often covered in fine hairs, giving it a soft, velvety texture. It thrives in rocky or gravelly soils and is often found in alpine or subalpine environments.
